Mammillary peduncle.EditorialNote: The description in Butler and Hodos (pg. 460) describes this as originating int he dorsal and ventral tegmental nuclei and terminating in the mammillary body.  The reciprocal connection is the mammillotegmental tract.  It seems like this should be classifed as a tract according to the definition.
Mammillary peduncle.Definition: White matter bundle in the posterior hypothalamus containing ascending afferent fibers to the mammillary bodies from the ventral and dorsal tegmental nuclei (Brodal, Neurological Anatomy, 3rd ed., 1981, pg 671).
